etymologies: Middle English: from Old Norse steik; related to steikja ‘roast on a spit’ and stikna ‘be roasted’

definitions: high-quality beef taken from the hindquarters of the animal, typically cut into thick slices that are cooked by broiling or frying
shortDefinitions: high-quality beef taken from hindquarters of animal

definitions: a thick slice of beef or other high-quality meat or fish
shortDefinitions: thick slice of steak or other high-quality meat or fish

definitions: poorer-quality beef that is cubed or ground and cooked more slowly by braising or stewing
shortDefinitions: poorer-quality beef that is cubed or minced and cooked by braising or stewing
